TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IStream

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for IStream and ISequentialStream in the the MSDN Library.
The common language runtime throws an exception when a COM method in native code returns an HRESULT. For more information, see How to: Map HRESULTs and Exceptions.

summary.para: Provides the managed definition of the IStream interface, with ISequentialStream functionality.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Clone (out System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream ppstm);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Clone(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream ppstm) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Commit (int grfCommitFlags);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Commit(int32 grfCommitFlags) cil managed

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for IStream::Commit in the MSDN Library.

summary.para: Ensures that any changes made to a stream object that is open in transacted mode are reflected in the parent storage.

Docs.param: A value that controls how the changes for the stream object are committed.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream pstm, long cb, IntPtr pcbRead, IntPtr pcbWritten);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyTo(class System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream pstm, int64 cb, native int pcbRead, native int pcbWritten) cil managed

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for IStream::CopyTo in the MSDN Library.

summary.para: Copies a specified number of bytes from the current seek pointer in the stream to the current seek pointer in another stream.

Docs.param: A reference to the destination stream.
The number of bytes to copy from the source stream.
On successful return, contains the actual number of bytes read from the source.
On successful return, contains the actual number of bytes written to the destination.

MemberSignature.Value: public void LockRegion (long libOffset, long cb, int dwLockType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void LockRegion(int64 libOffset, int64 cb, int32 dwLockType) cil managed

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for IStream::LockRegion in the MSDN Library.

summary.para: Restricts access to a specified range of bytes in the stream.

Docs.param: The byte offset for the beginning of the range.
The length of the range, in bytes, to restrict.
The requested restrictions on accessing the range.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Read (byte[] pv, int cb, IntPtr pcbRead);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Read(unsigned int8[] pv, int32 cb, native int pcbRead) cil managed

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for ISequentialStream::Read in the MSDN Library.

summary.para: Reads a specified number of bytes from the stream object into memory starting at the current seek pointer.

Docs.param: When this method returns, contains the data read from the stream. This parameter is passed uninitialized.
The number of bytes to read from the stream object.
A pointer to a ULONG variable that receives the actual number of bytes read from the stream object.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Revert ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Revert() cil managed

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for IStream::Revert in the MSDN Library.

summary.para: Discards all changes that have been made to a transacted stream since the last call.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Seek (long dlibMove, int dwOrigin, IntPtr plibNewPosition);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Seek(int64 dlibMove, int32 dwOrigin, native int plibNewPosition) cil managed

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for IStream::Seek in the MSDN Library.

summary.para: Changes the seek pointer to a new location relative to the beginning of the stream, to the end of the stream, or to the current seek pointer.

Docs.param: The displacement to add to .
The origin of the seek. The origin can be the beginning of the file, the current seek pointer, or the end of the file.
On successful return, contains the offset of the seek pointer from the beginning of the stream.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetSize (long libNewSize);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetSize(int64 libNewSize) cil managed

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for IStream::SetSize in the MSDN Library.

summary.para: Changes the size of the stream object.

Docs.param: The new size of the stream as a number of bytes.

Docs.param: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: public void UnlockRegion (long libOffset, long cb, int dwLockType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UnlockRegion(int64 libOffset, int64 cb, int32 dwLockType) cil managed

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for IStream::UnlockRegion in the MSDN Library.

summary.para: Removes the access restriction on a range of bytes previously restricted with the method.

Docs.param: The byte offset for the beginning of the range.
The length, in bytes, of the range to restrict.
The access restrictions previously placed on the range.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (byte[] pv, int cb, IntPtr pcbWritten);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Write(unsigned int8[] pv, int32 cb, native int pcbWritten) cil managed

remarks.para: For more information, see the existing documentation for ISequentialStream::Write in the MSDN Library.

summary.para: Writes a specified number of bytes into the stream object starting at the current seek pointer.

Docs.param: The buffer to write this stream to.
The number of bytes to write to the stream.
On successful return, contains the actual number of bytes written to the stream object. If the caller sets this pointer to , this method does not provide the actual number of bytes written.
